ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Gain an understanding of how urbanism and Latinx studies work together. Learn about how placemaking works alongside urban methods.

Throughout this course, I acquired a comprehensive understanding of the Latino experience within the United States. By delving into the subject matter, I was afforded the chance to showcase Montana as an emerging hub for Latinx individuals to converge and establish a collective sense of Latinidad. The course material encompassed various readings that critically examined the political and societal challenges faced by Latinx communities across the nation. Simultaneously, I had the privilege of listening to my peers' personal narratives and their distinctive perspectives on the intricacies of Latino place-making in the United States.

I learned the basics of spatial theory, through the eyes of the LA school of thought. Professor Hidalgo expanded on the theories of place to have us learn about being Latinx in more spatial terms. I developed an appreciation to learn how people and institutions shape space for their own projects.
I learned so much very interesting class
knowledge on how Latinx thought and presence creates and recreates space in the urban context.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: Diverse set of readings from different scholars & perspectives. Dr. Hidalgo is amazing at leading discussions and the class environment made it enjoyable. 
Weaknesses: Some weeks were VERY heavy on readings and sometimes it was hard to do the weekly reflections (300-500 words).

This course provides an exceptional opportunity for individuals seeking to delve deeper into the profound meaning of latinidad and explore the intricate concepts of space and place within the Latino community. Personally, I thoroughly enjoyed this course and appreciated the freedom it granted me to unleash my creativity.

The strengths are the content of the course as well as the discussions. A lot of the students in the class were ready to engage and connect spatial theories from readings to our own examples which provided very rich conversations. I also really enjoyed the co-facilitations as it allowed me to see the content through the eyes of my peers and see their interpretation as well as their practice of the content by having us to do an activity.
It could be improved by having more detailed information on expectations and assignments but was amazing material wise

strengths are class discussions, especially student lead facilitations, and reading content. 
Weakness are that some readings are not that relevant to the subject of the week and provide little to no insight into what the discussion is centering--on that note, the readings for every week are also really long and it is sometimes impossible to do all of them in time to post for the early discussion post deadline. I spoke to other students throughout the course and noticed that many people struggled with these aspects as well.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: No  I found it disengaging and disheartening
Yes! I came out of this class with a new understanding of how urban theory is embedded within Latinx studies and placemaking. Dr. Hidalgo is also very kind and willing to help you out.

Without a doubt, I highly recommend this course to any student at Yale University. Its in-depth exploration of the meaning of latinidad and the examination of space and place within the Latino community make it a valuable and enriching educational experience. Moreover, the course's allowance for creative expression and freedom of thought further enhances its appeal. As such, I strongly encourage Yale students to consider enrolling in this course and reap the benefits of its insightful content.
Yes, It was a great class learning about great topics, especially in ER&M
I definitely would! Despite being a heavier corse load, the topic is super interesting and worth knowing about. It completely shifts the way you see and engage in space
